intro: Lavoisiera goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazensis lavoisiera, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
